text: Now in Spanish you can say I responded her it.

text: Instead of saying it this way, to her mail, in Spanish you can just say I responded him the mail.

text: Or if you know what you're talking about, I responded him it.

text: This is because, and something we will look at again later, Spanish does not use possessive words as much as English does.

text: So what's very interesting here is that for ere verbs in the present we had E popping up everywhere.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: But everything else was E for ere verbs in the present.

text: But in the past for ere verbs we have I dominating the stage.

text: We have the I, I sound everywhere.

text: And this time the letter E, the E sound, occupying only one space, popping up in only one place, which is hieron.
